chunk-eca7c8b51cdc6605b35d4d74e1abbeca.entity_name: Shannon.AI (DEPARTMENT OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY, ZHEJIANG UNIVERSITY)
chunk-eca7c8b51cdc6605b35d4d74e1abbeca.description: Shannon.AI is the organization associated with the authors of the paper on dice loss for data-imbalanced NLP tasks, and it is also affiliated with the Department of Computer Science and Technology at Zhejiang University.
source_entities: DEPARTMENT OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY, ZHEJIANG UNIVERSITY

chunk-6dd1be559a398018f09dad69b307eede.description: BERT is a model developed by Devlin et al., 2018, used as the backbone for experiments in part-of-speech tagging and named entity recognition tasks.
Chinese Treebank is the organization responsible for creating the CTB5, CTB6 datasets used in part-of-speech tagging experiments, and is associated with Xue et al., 2005.
Wall Street Journal is the organization that provided the English dataset used in part-of-speech tagging experiments, and is associated with Ritter et al., 2011.
CTB5 and CTB6 are Chinese POS datasets used in part-of-speech tagging experiments, created by the Chinese Treebank organization.
OntoNotes datasets, including OntoNotes4.0, OntoNotes5.0, are used in named entity recognition experiments, and are associated with Pradhan et al., 2011 and Pradhan et al., 2013.
DSC refers to the Dynamic Sigmoid Cross-Entropy loss function used in the experiments, replacing MLE and compared with Focal Loss and Dice Loss.

chunk-ba8731394946285e9c56ecf440d2094d.description: BERT is a model developed by Devlin et al. (2018) that scores each candidate span to predict answers in question answering tasks. It is used as a baseline in various experiments.
XLNet is a model proposed by Yang et al. (2019) that uses a generalized autoregressive pretraining method to learn bidirectional contexts. It is used as a baseline in various experiments.
SQuAD refers to the Stanford Question Answering Dataset, which includes SQuAD v1.1 and SQuAD v2.0, used for evaluating question answering models.
DSC refers to the proposed loss function that has been shown to improve performance in question answering and paraphrase identification tasks. It is compared with MLE in various studies.
Spacy is a tool used for retrieving entity mentions and replacing them with new ones by linking mentions to their corresponding entities in DBpedia, utilized in data augmentation techniques.

MRC task refers to the machine reading comprehension task, which involves predicting answer spans in a given passage based on a question. PI task refers to the paraphrase identification task, which involves identifying whether two sentences have the same meaning.

Data augmentation techniques include positive augmentation, negative augmentation, negative downsampling, and positive and negative augmentation, used to create balanced or imbalanced datasets for training.

chunk-678bfa4737c32acd8e5ddf48b77e1439.description: IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks is the publisher of the paper on Ramoboost and is also known as a publication outlet for research in the field of neural networks.
arXiv is the platform where the preprints of the papers on Quoref and Learning to teach were published, serving as a repository for academic papers in various fields.

chunk-678bfa4737c32acd8e5ddf48b77e1439.entity_name: 2015 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV)
chunk-678bfa4737c32acd8e5ddf48b77e1439.description: The 2015 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV) is the event where the paper on Fast R-CNN was presented, and it is one of the leading conferences in the field of computer vision.
source_entities: 2015 IEEE INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON COMPUTER VISION (ICCV)

chunk-678bfa4737c32acd8e5ddf48b77e1439.entity_name: 2014 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
chunk-678bfa4737c32acd8e5ddf48b77e1439.description: The 2014 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition is the event where the paper on Rich feature hierarchies was presented, and it is a major conference for research in computer vision and pattern recognition.
source_entities: 2014 IEEE CONFERENCE ON COMPUTER VISION AND PATTERN RECOGNITION
